intro: Octarrhena papuana, commonly known as the Papuan octarrhena, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Papua. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
